English Content:
Maharaj, your māyā is extremely powerful. It has bound many men and women.
Give us the boon that this māyā will not entangle us... 1
Moreover, may we never develop an intellect of perceiving human traits in you.
May we perceive whatever actions you perform as divine... 2
May we never develop an aversion to any of your devotees.
May we never forget you because of an unfavorable place, time, and actions... 3
May our faith never sway due to lust, anger, greed, and infatuation.
We ask that whatever comes in the way of worshiping you never hinders us... 4
This much we ask, so please give this to us with compassion.
Maharaj, please listen to the things that we do not ask for... 5
Never give us the consciousness of the body, with which we forget you.
Do not give us the company of kusang and save us from adharma... 6
Do not give us worldly happiness. And do not give us the company of atheists.
Do not give us worldly greatness, arrogance, ill-will, or jealousy... 7
Do not give us bodily happiness, and do not give us the absence of your devotees.
Do not give us the aversion of your devotees and an egoistic nature... 8
Do not give us the company of nāstiks, who bar you and believe karmas alone are responsible for their liberation.
All of these we do not ask for. Have pity on us and give us this... 9
Then, Maharaj spoke and said, “I give you the boons you ask for.”
“You will not struggle with my māyā. You will not become bound by the body, etc.”... 10
“You will always perceive me as free of faults and will understand me as innocent.”
Hearing this, everyone rejoiced and believed it as true... 11
This is the ‘fagwā’ that Maharaj gave his devotees. Who else is powerful enough to give such boons?
Then, Maharaj played Holi with his devotees (sprayed them with colored water)... 12
